channel.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
channel.description:
[size=24pt]Part 1 Link:[/size] https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,662912.0.html
[size=14pt]Step 25:[/size] Now you will have something like this that will popup. Were it says Use default location you are going want to make sure it is uncheck. So click it.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/25_zps4c2e3ba0.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/25_zps4c2e3ba0.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 26:[/size] If should now look like this if you did correctly. Were it says Browse you are going to click that.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/26_zpsc02ae49a.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/26_zpsc02ae49a.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 27:[/size] Now you are going to locate your Server Folder and Click Client inside there. Then press OK when you have done this.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/27_zps3bf5cc91.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/27_zps3bf5cc91.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 28:[/size] If you did this correctly it should look similar to this. Then Click Finish and repeat Step 23, 24, 25, 26.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/28_zpsbf8a0ff5.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/28_zpsbf8a0ff5.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 29:[/size] Now once you have repeated those steps you are now going to find your Server Folder just like Step 27 but this time Click Server. Then press OK
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/29_zpsed2f16be.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/29_zpsed2f16be.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 30:[/size] It should look similar to this if you done correctly. Then press Finish.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/30_zpsf27ba8a0.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/30_zpsf27ba8a0.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 31:[/size] Once you have added both the folders to Eclipse it will look like this. If it does not please go back and follow the steps in order.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/31_zps75342f0f.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/31_zps75342f0f.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 32:[/size] Now you are going to Right click Server in eclipse go down were it says Run As and then click Run Configurations...
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/32_zps6c29cfde.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/32_zps6c29cfde.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 33:[/size] Now you are going right click Java Application and click New.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/33_zps6954ad3a.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/33_zps6954ad3a.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 34:[/size] Were it says Name: You are going want to rename this to Server. This will name your application to Server so it won't confuse you when you want to run your Server.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/34_zps4f347073.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/34_zps4f347073.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 35:[/size] It should Look like this. Now were it says Main Class: you are going want to Click Search...
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/35_zpsd2682d12.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/35_zpsd2682d12.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 36:[/size] Once you have clicked Search you will see multiple Class Files. Look for the one that says Launcher - org.virtue and click it then Press OK
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/36_zpsc97588da.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/36_zpsc97588da.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 37:[/size] It should now Look like this. Press Apply And then Click Run.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/37_zps8a77990e.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/37_zps8a77990e.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 38:[/size] Now you are going to Right Click Client and go to Run As then click Run Configurations...
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/38_zps56097a08.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/38_zps56097a08.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 39:[/size] Go to Java Application, Right Click and Click New.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/39_zpsa7d25e27.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/39_zpsa7d25e27.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 40:[/size] Were it says Name: You are going call this Client. Now were it says Main Class: you are going click Search...
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/40_zpse4ac090c.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/40_zpse4ac090c.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 41:[/size] Now there will only be 1 Class file Called RS3Applet - (default package) Click it then press OK
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/41_zps94100d09.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/41_zps94100d09.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 42:[/size] It will look like this if you done correctly. Now Click Apply then Run
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/42_zpsaf450129.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/42_zpsaf450129.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 43:[/size] If you did not click Run while you were setting up the applications for Client then right Click Client go to Run As and Click Java Application. If you did click run then you don't have to worry about it.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/43_zps3e8822a1.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/43_zps3e8822a1.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 44:[/size] If you did not click Run while you were setting up the applications for Server then right Click Server go to Run As and Click Java Application. If you did click run then you don't have to worry about it.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/44_zpsa6120e0d.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/44_zpsa6120e0d.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 45:[/size] Between the Bug and Green Button with toolbox there will be a Green Button with a arrow like a play button that will point to the right. Click the arrow that is facing down on the play button. And Click Server. This will run your server but
NOTE: Your server should already be running since earlier we clicked Run while we were setting up the Application. Now to close your server go into Task Manager and Close the Java. To find out witch Java it is go to Application in task manager and right click Eclipse then click Go to Process then the one highlighted will be your eclipse so that means the other java will be your server. But if you have more then 2 java up then one will be your Client.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/45_zps973011c4.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/45_zps973011c4.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 46:[/size] Repeat Step 45 but this time Click Client. This will run your Client. But it will not load your server if your server is not running so make sure your server is running.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/46_zpsa83efb3c.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/46_zpsa83efb3c.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 47:[/size] To find out that your server has loaded launched successfully down at the bottom there will be 4 things. Problems: You dont need to worry about these. Javadoc, Declartion, and Console. If your not in Console click Console. It should look like this from the time I posted this image 6-14-2014. If you are already running your Client then this will get cleared.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/47_zpsf7476bb6.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/47_zpsf7476bb6.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 48:[/size] Once you have launched your Client it will Load your files. You will have to restart your Client when it hits 93% you will notice when to stop it because nothing will load after words. Once you have restarted your client by relaunching your Client you will load the game successfully
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/48_zps018153b8.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/48_zps018153b8.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Step 49:[/size] Now login with any name and password.
NOTE: You can not reload you character if you exit him. It is a current bug that the creator of the pack that will need to fix or I will need to fix if it gets discontinued.
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/50_zps0720bcd1.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/50_zps0720bcd1.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/51_zps93475d72.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/51_zps93475d72.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/52_zps252b43bc.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/52_zps252b43bc.png[/img][/URL]
Let It Load
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/53_zpsfb5f6730.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/53_zpsfb5f6730.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/54_zps3c744b50.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/54_zps3c744b50.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/RS3%20Tutorial/55_zpsd5f584e3.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/RS3%20Tutorial/55_zpsd5f584e3.png[/img][/URL]
[size=14pt]Thanks for following my guide. Please leave me credit if you used this guide to help you make a server for you or some one else. [/size]
[center][size=14pt]And thanks for Sir James for making the RS3 and his team.
Credit for making guide: Me 100%[/size][/center]
[size=14pt]Please leave feed back, send to others who might have trouble and leave comments if you need help.[/size]
[center][size=14pt]Now play with all the 803 items! [/size]
[URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/asdasd_zps6cac776b.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/asdasd_zps6cac776b.png[/img][/URL] [URL=http://s1217.photobucket.com/user/amvoverwizzle/media/asdasdasd_zps9b11517c.png.html][IMG]http://i1217.photobucket.com/albums/dd390/amvoverwizzle/asdasdasd_zps9b11517c.png[/img][/URL][/center]

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @amvoverwizzle amvoverwizzle
item.description:
@amvoverwizzle wrote:

[quote=“luxeh, post:32, topic:544033”]Hey!
I just get this error up all the time:
[Virtue Logger]: Welcome to RuneLove 3.
[Virtue Logger]: Loading cache.
[Virtue Logger]: An exception has been caught on engine cycle # 0. Terminating process.
[Virtue Logger]: Total runtime: 0 seconds, 0 minutes, 0 hours, 0 days.
java.io.FileNotFoundException
at org.virtue.cache.FileStore.open(FileStore.java:51)
at org.virtue.cache.tools.CacheLoader.init(CacheLoader.java:22)
at org.virtue.cache.tools.CacheLoader.getCache(CacheLoader.java:27)
at org.virtue.Launcher.loadCache(Launcher.java:114)
at org.virtue.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:82)

Some1 know what it means or how to fix it?
Thanks if u reply :D[/quote]

If you haven’t already I would try to start over by making a new folder with a new eclipse folder as well. See if that works.

Read full topic
item.source: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @luxeh luxeh
item.description:
@luxeh wrote:

Hey!
I just get this error up all the time:
[Virtue Logger]: Welcome to RuneLove 3.
[Virtue Logger]: Loading cache.
[Virtue Logger]: An exception has been caught on engine cycle # 0. Terminating process.
[Virtue Logger]: Total runtime: 0 seconds, 0 minutes, 0 hours, 0 days.
java.io.FileNotFoundException
at org.virtue.cache.FileStore.open(FileStore.java:51)
at org.virtue.cache.tools.CacheLoader.init(CacheLoader.java:22)
at org.virtue.cache.tools.CacheLoader.getCache(CacheLoader.java:27)
at org.virtue.Launcher.loadCache(Launcher.java:114)
at org.virtue.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:82)

Some1 know what it means or how to fix it?
Thanks if u reply

Read full topic

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2

item.description:
@amvoverwizzle wrote:

j to top:

when i try to run the server i get an error that says “could not find the main class: org.virtyue.launcher. Program will exit.” Please help.

Make sure you follow every step. Because you might of not assign the proper class

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @amvoverwizzle amvoverwizzle
item.description:
@amvoverwizzle wrote:

[quote=“basgolde, post:28, topic:544033”]Got a few issues for this server,

  • Character doesnt attack? (the rat or the guard).
  • I dont hear musictracks from the game?
  • Crashes after 30 sec walking around.
  • Command developer doesnt open if I type ALT + ~.

Any solution for the ones above?
Thanks![/quote]

The crash dont happen to me useally. the owner dint put music in there, and he dint start the basic att system but only putted slice in the ability move witch does nothing atm. Hold alt ~

Read full topic

item.description:
@basgolde wrote:

Got a few issues for this server,

  • Character doesnt attack? (the rat or the guard).
  • I dont hear musictracks from the game?
  • Crashes after 30 sec walking around.
  • Command developer doesnt open if I type ALT + ~.

Any solution for the ones above?
Thanks!

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @amvoverwizzle amvoverwizzle
item.description:
@amvoverwizzle wrote:

[quote=“sniedzins, post:23, topic:544033”]I have error when I run the client.

Unused client paramater: key=13, value=false
error_game_js5connect

How to fix it? I follow all steps[/quote]

Make sure you are running your server.

js5connect error will only show if the server is not running in the background.

Read full topic
item.source: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @basgolde basgolde
item.description:
@basgolde wrote:

Yeah I had but i deleted them from my firewall.

But I cant remember how I put my IP into this new server so it runs on my IP/router.

03:38 PM New message (modify)
Wow i managed to login anyway strange tough.

Anyone knows how to stop the crashes? Or anything? Thanks! Or to instant level all skills to 99?

Read full topic
item.source: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

[quote=“basgolde, post:24, topic:544033”][Virtue Logger]: An exception has been caught on engine cycle # 2. Terminating process.
[Virtue Logger]: Total runtime: 6 seconds, 0 minutes, 0 hours, 0 days.
org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelException: Failed to bind to: 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0:43594
at org.jboss.netty.bootstrap.ServerBootstrap.bind(Serve[/color]rBootstrap.java:272)
at org.virtue.network.ChannelFilter.start(ChannelFilter.java:55)
at org.virtue.network.RS2Network.load(RS2Network.java:81)
at org.virtue.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:86)
Caused by: java.net.BindException: Address already in use: bind <--------------------
at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind0(Native Method)
at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerBoss$RegisterTask.run(NioServerBoss.java:193)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.AbstractNioSelector.processTaskQueue(AbstractNioSelector.java:372)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.AbstractNioSelector.run(AbstractNioSelector.java:296)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerBoss.run(NioServerBoss.java:42)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/color]

Anyone knows how to fix this? Thanks![/quote]

Is it possible you were already running a server? (You can’t run 2 servers on the same port)

Read full topic
item.source: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @basgolde basgolde
item.description:
@basgolde wrote:

Fixed the Client by doing: Right click on Client - Properties - Java Compiler - set 1.4 to 1.7.

Now I can run the Client till it says login with username and password (ofc).

But the Client wont be able to login because (I think) the server is not on.

It gives this erros:

[Virtue Logger]: Welcome to RuneLove 3.
[Virtue Logger]: Loading cache.
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 0
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 1
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 2
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 3
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 5
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 7
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 8
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 9
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 10
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 12
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 13
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 14
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 16
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 17
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 18
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 19
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 20
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 21
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 22
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 23
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 24
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 25
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 26
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 27
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 28
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 29
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 30
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 31
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 32
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 33
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 34
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 35
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 36
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 37
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 38
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 39
[Virtue Logger]: Decoding cache index 40
[Virtue Logger]: Loaded 31144 item definitions.
[Virtue Logger]: Loaded 19280 NPC definitions.
[Virtue Logger]: Loaded 90242 object definitions.
[Virtue Logger]: Loaded 8078 world NPCs!
[Virtue Logger]: Loading packets.
[Virtue Logger]: Creating new account for user: Testrecruiter
[Virtue Logger]: Initialising clan channel manager.
[Virtue Logger]: Loading clan index…
[Virtue Logger]: No clan index file was found.
[Virtue Logger]: An exception has been caught on engine cycle # 2. Terminating process.
[Virtue Logger]: Total runtime: 6 seconds, 0 minutes, 0 hours, 0 days.
org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelException: Failed to bind to: 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0:43594
at org.jboss.netty.bootstrap.ServerBootstrap.bind(ServerBootstrap.java:272)
at org.virtue.network.ChannelFilter.start(ChannelFilter.java:55)
at org.virtue.network.RS2Network.load(RS2Network.java:81)
at org.virtue.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:86)
Caused by: java.net.BindException: Address already in use: bind
at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind0(Native Method)
at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerBoss$RegisterTask.run(NioServerBoss.java:193)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.AbstractNioSelector.processTaskQueue(AbstractNioSelector.java:372)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.AbstractNioSelector.run(AbstractNioSelector.java:296)
at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerBoss.run(NioServerBoss.java:42)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/color]

Anyone knows how to fix this? Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“jrbtfc, post:16, topic:544033”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=662913.msg4430534#msg4430534 date=1403047161]
Hey while you’re at it, can you tell me how to turn on my computer? because you seemed to miss that step when you explained everything else in detail…

Seriously, this tutorial is way too big for what you’re teaching. It shouldn’t need 2 parts, and it shouldn’t need 49 steps. Like jesus.

Step 1) Download a server.
Step 2) Download Eclipse.
Step 3) Open the server in eclipse.
Step 4) Run.

^All you need. The “hardest” part is opening the project in eclipse. Which is nothing more than clicking “Create a new project” and unchecking the default box, then browsing to your project.
[/quote]

What? His thread is explaining to a beginner how to do this. You say it yourself, that a tutorial is to teach you something. Since when does reading textbooks become more effective than reading a textbook with pictures that show you the steps? Pictures stick in my mind more than text.

While I would have figured it out eventually with your steps, here’s how I could see someone else doing it:
[spoiler]
Your steps:
Step 1) Download a server. - Oh, I have Windows Server 2012 already on Microsoft Licensing site! Should I use R2?
Step 2) Download Eclipse. - That’s a paintball company, not sure how to download them. Maybe one of the manuals?
Step 3) Open the server in eclipse. - I’ll give up here because I’m still calling Eclipse to see how I can download them.
Step 4) Run. Should I go outside for this? - Still on the phone with Eclipse.[/spoiler]

Perfect guide. This is how they all should be.[/quote]
If you followed the steps like that I’d feel bad for you and question your intelligence.

  1. You’re following a tutorial on a website dedicated to RuneScape Private Servers. So when someone says, “Download a server” that would most commonly be referred to a private server, unless specified otherwise.

  2. I’ve never heard of the paintball company called eclipse, however, searching eclipse on google gave me these results:

    Sources tell me that the links shown say it’s an Integrated Development Environment, or IDE. Which this is a tutorial on.
    It’s also know that these RSPS’s are done in Java. So you’d obviously download one on that downloads page for Java.

  3. Can’t respond here because you’re just being an idiot.

  4. Again, being an idiot.

Read full topic
item.source: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2

Seriously, this tutorial is way too big for what you’re teaching. It shouldn’t need 2 parts, and it shouldn’t need 49 steps. Like jesus.

Step 1) Download a server.
Step 2) Download Eclipse.
Step 3) Open the server in eclipse.
Step 4) Run.

^All you need. The “hardest” part is opening the project in eclipse. Which is nothing more than clicking “Create a new project” and unchecking the default box, then browsing to your project.
[/quote]

What? His thread is explaining to a beginner how to do this. You say it yourself, that a tutorial is to teach you something. Since when does reading textbooks become more effective than reading a textbook with pictures that show you the steps? Pictures stick in my mind more than text.

While I would have figured it out eventually with your steps, here’s how I could see someone else doing it:
[spoiler]
Your steps:
Step 1) Download a server. - Oh, I have Windows Server 2012 already on Microsoft Licensing site! Should I use R2?
Step 2) Download Eclipse. - That’s a paintball company, not sure how to download them. Maybe one of the manuals?
Step 3) Open the server in eclipse. - I’ll give up here because I’m still calling Eclipse to see how I can download them.
Step 4) Run. Should I go outside for this? - Still on the phone with Eclipse.[/spoiler]

Perfect guide. This is how they all should be.[/quote]
I am warning you, sk8 will come back, HARD!

item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

Lol the first time I started programming, I downloaded an IDE (Eclipse), there was no need for me to look at a tutorial-- especially a tutorial this big. They made it so simple, they labeled everything using the simplest words (Ex. File<New<Java Project). All labels are to the point and just need common sense.

P.s It’s just like any other type of software, it has the original File<New, and it has the ‘easy to understand’ pop-ups.

I say you should just simple it down a bit. Like sk8r says

It shouldn’t need 2 parts, and it shouldn’t need 49 steps

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @amvoverwizzle amvoverwizzle
item.description:
@amvoverwizzle wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:544033”][quote author=amvoverwizzle link=topic=662913.msg4430546#msg4430546 date=1403048223]
Every picture is necessary for beginners. Those who never setup a Rsps in Eclipse before will show every aspect of what you needs to do. You don’t really have to read it you can look at the pictures and find it out easy that way.
[/quote]
The point of a tutorial is to READ. Tutorials are to TEACH you something. not for you to look at pictures. The pictures are supposed to be there to show examples of finished products, or something that would be explained easier in a picture than words.[/quote]

You can’t always learn something by reading it. Some times you need a visual of what it looks like such as pictures that shows what to do and when you done it correctly. Lot of people out there need visual to learn and it something they can’t help but to live with.

item.source: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2

item.title: [6-16-2014] How to setup RS3, RS2 and RS1 Server in Eclipse IDE Part 2
item.dc:creator: @amvoverwizzle amvoverwizzle
item.description:
@amvoverwizzle wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:544033”][quote author=amvoverwizzle link=topic=662913.msg4430538#msg4430538 date=1403047585]

Hey while you’re at it, can you tell me how to turn on my computer? because you seemed to miss that step when you explained everything else in detail…

Seriously, this tutorial is way too big for what you’re teaching. It shouldn’t need 2 parts, and it shouldn’t need 49 steps. Like jesus.

Step 1) Download a server.
Step 2) Download Eclipse.
Step 3) Open the server in eclipse.
Step 4) Run.

^All you need. The “hardest” part is opening the project in eclipse. Which is nothing more than clicking “Create a new project” and unchecking the default box, then browsing to your project.

I agree but I had no choice because it is 24,000 words long and max per thread is 20,000. But this tutorial is also for those who never knew how to set up a Evolution of combat server. By following this guide it lets new people follow each step if there not familiar on how to set a server up in eclipse IDE. This guide is necessary for beginnings and to help those who get stuck.
[/quote]
No, this guide is over the top.
You do not need pictures for each step (that’s where you’re losing so many precious characters).
You do not need to explain each step
Setting up an “Evolution of combat server” is the same as setting up any other server, or java project in general, in eclipse.

Also, that character bug, it’s probably related to an appearance flag not being sent. The guy released a incomplete project, I’m pretty sure he stated that somewhere. It’s going to be full of bugs. Why? Because it’s not done. RuneScape, where we’re taking the content from, has bugs in it still. Do you really think his will be perfected?[/quote]

Every picture is necessary for beginners. Those who never setup a Rsps in Eclipse before will show every aspect of what you needs to do. You don’t really have to read it you can look at the pictures and find it out easy that way.

Read full topic
